author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: تَرَى يا إِلهِي كَيْفَ حَالَ بَيْنَ عِبادِكَ وَمَظْهَرِ نَفْسِكَ ظُلْمُ المُعْرِضِينَ مِن خَلْقِكَ، أَيْ رَبِّ فَأَنْزِلْ عَلَيْهِمْ ما يُشْغِلُهُمْ بِأَنْفُسِهِمْ، ثُمَّ اجْعَلْ بِأْسَهُمْ بَيْنَهُمْ لِتَسْتَرِيحَ بِذلِكَ الأَرْضُ وَمَنْ عَلَيْها، أَيْ رَبِّ إِنَّ أَمَةً
translation: Thou seest, O my God, how the wrongs committed by such of Thy creatures as have turned their backs to Thee have come in between Him in Whom Thy Godhead is manifest and Thy servants. Send down upon them, O my Lord, what will cause them to be busied with each others’ concerns. Let, then, their violence be confined to their own selves, that the land and they that dwell therein may find peace.
